TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed PackageInterleavingOrder extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Provides values that specify the order in which the major parts of a package are streamed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you specify ResourceFirst, each dependent object is serialized before the object on which it depends. When you specify ResourceLast, information about how a resource will be used is streamed before the resource. To display text first so that users can read while the images are opening, specify the ImagesLast member.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackageInterleavingOrder ImagesLast = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The streaming order is: resource (other than images), page, document, document sequence, and images.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackageInterleavingOrder None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The streaming order is specified by the packaging system.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackageInterleavingOrder ResourceFirst = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The streaming order is: resource, page, document, and document sequence.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackageInterleavingOrder ResourceLast = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The streaming order is: document sequence, document, page, and resource.
